articles.title: Exercise Heightens Brain's Food Cue Reactivity - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Exercise appears to amplify the brain's response to food cues, a new study reports.
articles.content:
Summary: Exercise appears to amplify the brain’s response to food cues, a new study reports.
Researchers observed that running increased the reactivity of certain brain regions linked to attention, … [+7051 chars]

articles.content:

articles.title: Diet Coke or Coke Zero: Experts give their verdict on which option is healthier - Daily Mail
articles.description: Diet Coke and Coke Zero have zero sugar and are low calorie, but many debate which one is healthier. Dietitians have given DailyMail.com their verdict, along with five other matchups.
articles.content:
They are both sugar-free, low-calorie and taste almost as good as the real thing. 
But there have been arguments aplenty over whether Diet Coke or Coke Zero is the healthier option.
